A **snow golem**, ', is a type of monster that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a strong type of [golem](/wiki/Golem "Golem") that can pick up items.

A snow golem has a cold breath attack, a snowball-firing attack, and a very strong claw attack that can inflict [knockback](/index.php?title=Knockback\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Knockback (page does not exist)").

## Generation

Snow golems are not randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), and are always created hostile.

In the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm"), a snow golem is generated on the topmost floor in front of the down stair at level creation, and two snow golems are generated in the foyer of the castle on the lowest floor at level creation. [Kathryn the Ice Queen](/wiki/Kathryn_the_Ice_Queen "Kathryn the Ice Queen") can also summon snow golems via the [summon minion](/wiki/Summon_minion "Summon minion") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell").

Snow golems [never leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death, like most golems.

## Encyclopedia entry

"The original story harks back, so they say, to the sixteenth  
century. Using long-lost formulas from the Kabbala, a rabbi is  
said to have made an artificial man -- the so-called Golem -- to  
help ring the bells in the Synagogue and for all kinds of other  
menial work.  
"But he hadn't made a full man, and it was animated by some sort  
of vegetable half-life. What life it had, too, so the story  
runs, was only derived from the magic charm placed behind its  
teeth each day, that drew down to itself what was known as the  
\`free sidereal strength of the universe.'  
"One evening, before evening prayers, the rabbi forgot to take  
the charm out of the Golem's mouth, and it fell into a frenzy.  
It raged through the dark streets, smashing everything in its  
path, until the rabbi caught up with it, removed the charm, and  
destroyed it. Then the Golem collapsed, lifeless. All that was  
left of it was a small clay image, which you can still see in  
the Old Synagogue." ...  
\[ The Golem, by Gustav Meyrink ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Snow_golem\&action=edit)*

html:
Snow golem

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
' snow golem (No tile)
Difficulty 25
Attacks Breath 6d8 cold, Spit 1d6 cold, Claw 8d10 knock-back damage
' snow golem (No tile)
Difficulty 25
Attacks

Breath 6d8 cold, Spit 1d6 cold, Claw 8d10 knock-back damage

Base level 22
Base experience 715
Speed 8
Base AC -3
Base MR 80
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 2800
Nutritional value 0
Size Huge
Resistances cold,electricity,sleep,poison
Resistances conveyed None

A snow golem:

  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 2831

A snow golem, ', is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. It is a strong type of golem that can pick up items.

A snow golem has a cold breath attack, a snowball-firing attack, and a very strong claw attack that can inflict knockback.

Generation

Snow golems are not randomly generated in Gehennom, and are always created hostile.

In the Ice Queen's Realm, a snow golem is generated on the topmost floor in front of the down stair at level creation, and two snow golems are generated in the foyer of the castle on the lowest floor at level creation. Kathryn the Ice Queen can also summon snow golems via the summon minion monster spell.

Snow golems never leave a corpse upon death, like most golems.

Encyclopedia entry

"The original story harks back, so they say, to the sixteenth
century. Using long-lost formulas from the Kabbala, a rabbi is
said to have made an artificial man -- the so-called Golem -- to
help ring the bells in the Synagogue and for all kinds of other
menial work.
"But he hadn't made a full man, and it was animated by some sort
of vegetable half-life. What life it had, too, so the story
runs, was only derived from the magic charm placed behind its
teeth each day, that drew down to itself what was known as the
`free sidereal strength of the universe.'
"One evening, before evening prayers, the rabbi forgot to take
the charm out of the Golem's mouth, and it fell into a frenzy.
It raged through the dark streets, smashing everything in its
path, until the rabbi caught up with it, removed the charm, and
destroyed it. Then the Golem collapsed, lifeless. All that was
left of it was a small clay image, which you can still see in
the Old Synagogue." ...
[ The Golem, by Gustav Meyrink ]

A '''snow golem''', {{brightcyan|'}}, is a type of monster that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a strong type of [[golem]] that can pick up items.

A snow golem has a cold breath attack, a snowball-firing attack, and a very strong claw attack that can inflict [[knockback]].

==Generation==
Snow golems are not randomly generated in [[Gehennom]], and are always created hostile.

In the [[Ice Queen's Realm]], a snow golem is generated on the topmost floor in front of the down stair at level creation, and two snow golems are generated in the foyer of the castle on the lowest floor at level creation. [[Kathryn the Ice Queen]] can also summon snow golems via the [[summon minion]] [[monster spell]].

Snow golems [[Corpseless|never leave a corpse]] upon death, like most golems.
